item.title: Entertainment Technology Company Feature.io Signs With WME (EXCLUSIVE)
item.dc:creator: Hell
item.description: Feature.io, an entertainment studio and technology company, has signed with WME. The company, behind campaigns that utilize engagement technology like the marketing behind Vol. 3 of Netflix’s sci-fi series “Love, Death + Robots,” will be exclusively represented by the agency. One of the company’s upcoming creative projects is “Lollipop Racing,” a professional racing streaming series produced...
item.content:encoded:
Feature.io, an entertainment studio and technology company, has signed with WME. The company, behind campaigns that utilize engagement technology like the marketing behind Vol. 3 of Netflix’s sci-fi series “Love, Death + Robots,” will be exclusively represented by the agency.

One of the company’s upcoming creative projects is “Lollipop Racing,” a professional racing streaming series produced by Feature and written and executive produced by “The Fast and the Furious” creator David Ayer. “Lollipop Racing” consists of a narrative-driven series as well as an interactive fantasy sports-like strategy game powered by Feature’s engagement technology, Smart Content. Audiences can engage with each race and become a part of the story as it unfolds.

Entertainment Technology Company Feature.io Signs With WME (EXCLUSIVE)

by GlobalPulseNews

Related Stories

Warner Bros. Games Acquires ‘MultiVersus’ Developer Player First Games

‘Astro Bot’ Game Coming to PlayStation 5 in September

The company seeks to allow fans to not only be spectators to the content they consume, but become “active participants shaping the content they love.”

Mobil 1 recently announced a partnership with Feature.io and “Lollipop Racing”, joining the project as presenting sponsor. WME will represent the property to major streaming platforms.

“We’re proud to have a global entertainment leader like WME’s support as we debut our technology and revolutionize the fan experience both in ‘Lollipop Racing’ and beyond,” said Steven Ilous, CEO and founder of Feature.io. “We look forward to deepening the connection between fans, brands and creators with Smart Content-powered projects and sharing Next-Generation Storytelling with the world.”

The company’s Smart Content technology allows viewers to actively participate with their favorite content and links fans with creators, IP, brands and studios. Audiences are provided with tangible rewards for engaging with different content, like coupons, early access to experiences and limited-edition digital collectables.

Feature.io debuted a beta version of the engagement technology with its campaign for Vol. 3 of “Love Death, + Robots,” which saw the technology embedded into marketing materials and within the show itself.

item.title: ‘Astro Bot’ Game Coming to PlayStation 5 in September
item.dc:creator: Hell
item.description: A new “Astro Bot” game will be launching on PlayStation 5 on Sept. 6, Sony’s PlayStation revealed Thursday during its virtual “State of Play” presentation featuring upcoming titles. Per PlayStation’s description, “In this brand-new game, you will explore six galaxies and over 80 levels in search of Astro’s scattered crew. Hold on tight to your Dual Speeder...
item.content:encoded:
A new “Astro Bot” game will be launching on PlayStation 5 on Sept. 6, Sony’s PlayStation revealed Thursday during its virtual “State of Play” presentation featuring upcoming titles.

Per PlayStation’s description, “In this brand-new game, you will explore six galaxies and over 80 levels in search of Astro’s scattered crew. Hold on tight to your Dual Speeder and dive down to each unique planet, from lush forests, sandy beaches, hot volcanoes to more surprising locations such as a gigantic hourglass or the canopy of a singing tree!”

The character Astro Bot first appeared in the 2018 PlayStation game “Astro Bot Rescue Mission.” He returned in “Astro Playroom,” a free technical game used to showcase the PS5’s capabilities at launch in 2020.

‘Astro Bot’ Game Coming to PlayStation 5 in September

By GlobalPulseNews

Related Stories

Entertainment Technology Company Feature.io Signs With WME (EXCLUSIVE)

Warner Bros. Games Acquires ‘MultiVersus’ Developer Player First Games

The “State of Play” online event, which focused heavily on titles that will be available for PS5 and PS VR2, also included a first look at gameplay for the upcoming game “Concord,” as well as the announcement of the game’s coming release on Aug. 23. The title, developed by Firewalk, is described as a 5v5 character-driven, first-person multiplayer shooter set in the Concord galaxy. “Concord” is a live services game that will include regular updates.

First look and release date news was also revealed about additional PlayStation and third-party titles, including a PC version of “God of War Ragnarök,” “Infinity Nikki,” “Dynasty Warriors,” “Ballad of Antara,” Skydance’s “Behemoth,” 20th Century Games’ “Alien: Rogue Incursion,” “Where Winds Meet,” NetEase Games’ “Marvel Rivals,” “Until Dawn,” “Path of Exile 2,” the “Silent Hill 2” remake and “Monster Hunter Wilds.”

New PlayStation co-CEOs Hideaki Nishino and Hermen Hulst did not appear during the presentation, which was instead led by multiple PlayStation developers and execs, including head of PlayStation Productions Asad Qizilbash.

The “State of Play” event, which was first announced Wednesday, took place a week before Summer Game Fest, when video game companies and studios will be in attendance to unveil news about their new titles at different events. PlayStation’s biggest competitor, Microsoft’s Xbox, will host its own showcase event pegged to the festival on June 9.

See a teaser for “Astro Bot” below.
